decks.notes: Utilizing low life totals and efficient removal spells, the deck aims to quickly deploy large threats like Death's Shadow and Murktide Regent while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes various cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to find key pieces and maintain card advantage. With a mix of tempo plays and powerful threats, the deck looks to close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and quickly overwhelm them with aggressive dragon creatures. By utilizing cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, this deck aims to control the board and slow down the opponent's game plan. With powerful creatures like Pyrogoyf and Fury, along with removal spells like Sundering Eruption, the goal is to deal damage quickly and efficiently, ultimately securing victory through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm opponents with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. By using fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal, the deck is able to quickly deploy its threats and apply pressure on the opponent. The combination of disruptive elements and aggressive creatures allows the deck to control the game and close out matches efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of Wasteland helps to disrupt opponent's mana base and further tilt the odds in favor of the Eldrazi Aggro player.

The deck aims to quickly and aggressively combo off by milling the entire library and winning the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. It utilizes sacrifice effects, free mana acceleration, and disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key to success lies in efficiently emptying the library and utilizing graveyard recursion to achieve victory in a single explosive turn. The deck's speed and consistency make it a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through targeted discard spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, as well as countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. It also aims to control the board with removal spells such as Snuff Out and Fatal Push. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Murktide Regent provide card advantage and threats to close out the game quickly. The deck's mana base includes Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and a mix of fetch lands and dual lands for consistent color fixing.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Magus of the Moon and Hullbreacher. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Snapcaster Mage. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents for extra card advantage. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game and outlasting the opponent to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with big creatures, then reanimate them onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Shallow Grave. The deck also utilizes discard spells like Unmask and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own combo pieces. By efficiently bringing back powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty, Griselbrand, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory through a powerful board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, then bring them back onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruption cards like Unmask and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo pieces and deal with opposing threats. This combo-reanimator deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing a high number of low-cost spells and mana acceleration to quickly assemble a combo that results in winning the game in one explosive turn. By utilizing cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire library into the graveyard, spells like Dread Return or Thassa's Oracle can be used to secure victory. The deck aims to be fast and consistent, aiming to win before the opponent has a chance to react or disrupt the combo.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on controlling the board by using disruptive spells and removal like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Force of Will while applying pressure with efficient creatures such as Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck also utilizes card selection and draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right answers at the right time. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily advancing its own board state to secure victory through a combination of tempo advantage and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to rapidly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of aggressive creatures and tempo-based spells. By leveraging cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect their threats and disrupt the opponent's plays, while using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruption spells, the Dimir Tempo deck seeks to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck revolves around using cards like Grindstone and Painter's Servant to combo off and mill the opponent's deck. Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder help to find and recur key pieces, while disruption is provided through cards like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast. Urza's Saga and Fabled of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional utility and engine pieces. The deck aims to assemble the combo quickly and protect it with cards like Ensnaring Bridge. Overall, the strategy involves controlling the board and winning the game through a powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on a strategy of disruption and aggression, utilizing powerful tempo plays to control the game while applying pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while deploying efficient threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, Murktide Regent, and Orcish Bowmasters to close out the game quickly. With a mix of disruption, removal, and powerful threats, this deck aims to dictate the pace of the game and come out ahead in the end.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up to play powerful Eldrazi creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats while also controlling the board with cards like Wasteland and Reality Smasher. By utilizing fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith, this deck can deploy its threats ahead of schedule and close out games quickly.

Utilizing a combination of disruptive creatures and mana denial tactics, this Legacy Death & Taxes deck aims to pressure the opponent while controlling the board state. With access to powerful removal spells and disruptive creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Stoneforge Mystic, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a threatening board presence. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in long games, making this deck a versatile and adaptive choice in the Legacy format.

The deck aims to utilize Gaea's Cradle to generate massive amounts of mana to cast powerful creatures and spells, while also controlling the board with cards like Collector Ouphe and Wasteland. It focuses on accelerating its mana production through ramp cards like Noble Hierarch and Green Sun's Zenith, and can use Natural Order to quickly fetch out a game-winning creature like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also has graveyard recursion options with cards like Endurance and Springheart Nantuko, allowing it to outvalue opponents in the late game.
